div1.head: Letter fragment from [Henry Rose Carter] to [Laura Eugenia Hook Carter], March 11, 1916
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
BALTIMORE, MD March 11/16
Augusta Ga
(The Albiar Hotel)
Dear Laura:
div1.p:
I got here Thursday afternoon- about 3 P.M
say the Power Company & went out with their sur-
veyor yesterday in a motor boat - up the river
to Stevens' Creek - about 19 miles each way,
Walked about 5 or 6. It was quite cold coming
back- We left the hotel at 7 A.M. & returned to it at
8. P.M. - & I was a little lame of one leg- from
walking. I did not catch cold however & am
feeling all right at present.

I have not seen the Power Company people this
morning & so can't say when I will get back. I judge
by Monday however. If I don't do so I will advise
you. I don't know whether my train gets in
in the morning or afternoon
